title: payablcc
author: payablcc
content: Payabl.cc is an upcoming innovative crypto payments platform made for simplifying buying & selling online with cryptocurrency. Current crypto payment providers require a long onboarding process, and don't make use of browser wallets and smart contracts - Payabl.cc will tackle all of these issues in order to make crypto payments more accessible on the web!Please help us by filling out our user research form: https://0qq14igvjan.typeform.com/to/A7BwEG3XFollow us on Twitter: @payabl_ccThank you for reading!

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: I just take a look at the domain and there is no site yet. Please tell us more about the project, I really would like to know how you will make that process simpler. It would be nice if you can share with the community the white paper or at least a road map of the project that would get more people involved.Will your project create a new browser wallet or people will need to use addons like Metamask?

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: payablcc on December 11, 2022, 01:56:46 PMCurrent crypto payment providers require a long onboarding process,Although some of the providers fit the description, I still don't think it'd be fair to squeeze all of them into a single category.- I get that you're trying to promote an upcoming product, but don't do it at the expense of other providers!Quote from: payablcc on December 11, 2022, 01:56:46 PMand don't make use of browser walletsPersonally, I see this as a good thing and with regard to the last question, I prefer not to link my online identity to any kind of platform.

comments.author: payablcc
comments.body: Thank you for your replies! We have registered the domain recently, and will get a landing page up and running by the weekend. This should give more in depth explanation along with our current work in progress

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: So your service would allow you to make purchases on sites that connect metamask to your platform through a smart contract I assume.  And how do I verify the integrity of the contract and see if it's a honeypot and doesn't empty my wallet?  Sorry for my question but I've seen a lot of bad things about using metamasks and smart contracts.

comments.author: payablcc
comments.body: Quote from: mendace on December 20, 2022, 11:14:05 PMSo your service would allow you to make purchases on sites that connect metamask to your platform through a smart contract I assume.  And how do I verify the integrity of the contract and see if it's a honeypot and doesn't empty my wallet?  Sorry for my question but I've seen a lot of bad things about using metamasks and smart contracts. All purchases will be made through our website, not external sites. We plan on providing an API as well, but payments should always be made on the payabl.cc webaite. Security is the main concern, and confirming transactions on our website give us more control on assuring all payments run smoothly.Your feedback is highly appreciated, and bitcointalk is great to get the more technical questions. Do you have any other examples of dApp security issues with Metamask?

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: So your site will act as an escrow of buying and selling operations? In the sense that you provide a centralized service? What is the role of the blockchain here, meaning that internal transfers will be centralized or will they take place on the blockchain, and if on the blockchain, how much are the fees?your site lookalikes PayPal isn't cause any problem.
